ratings.comment: One of the best of the best at UW, noteworthy for her ability to inspire listening and consequent production from majors and non-majors alike. Also a top intellectual figure in Media Studies in the 1990s and 2000s, who was able to extend her seminal work in one discipline by helping to build an entirely new (and overdue) department for the campus.

Julie is one of my favorite professors! Queer Film had such amazing content and we had such incredible class discussions. It made me a much more critical  movie watcher. The reading reports took forever, but it made me actually do them, which is good. Great class if you love engaging in great class conversations!

Julie was ultra kind and sweet. She really cares about her students and their comprehension of the material. She can sometimes be a bit unclear about her expectations, but she is very willing to clarify and assist students at every turn in her coursework. I would highly recommend her.

julie is an awesome professor! the readings and journals can be a bit tedious but this woman truly cares about her students (a rarity at such a large school) and really wants to hear their own opinions.  take any class with her, she's great!
she is passionate about the class, sometime it could be hard, but it is very interesting
Julie is an amazing teacher, truly has a gift!  Loved going to her classes, always had great discussions
This class is phenomenal, no midterm or final for this semester-fall 2013- she really takes into account how and what we want to learn and see in gender constructions in media

Gender and Media: Summer class. Superb. Everyone in class agreed. Really supportive of all opinions. Meeting 4 times a week may have had something to do with it... We had an hour of reading, and had to hand in 5 main points and response to each, but it really helped conversation. two 4 page papers and a 2.5 final, but fair, and good feedback.

Class was not what I was expecting. She does very little lecturing, but instead relies on students to share their amateur opinions the entire class period. Makes you write a page-long response for every single reading, which was ridiculous. She's an easy grader but doesn't give much feedback. The videos were mostly interesting.

Interesting topics and we get to watch movies all the time! Very light work load, no textbook only online articles. D'Acci is so kind and actually cares about what her students think. Great discussion environment, overall I highly recommend this class

Prof D'Acci is great!  She is so genuine and makes her material interesting.  Loved that she was willing to say "I don't know the answer to that question, but I will find out for you" instead of just making it up!
great teacher, highly articulate and knowledgeable.
Prof. D'Acci is most articulate.

Easy class if you take good notes during lecture.  Very detail based exams and some writing involved.  Figure out what your TA wants in your papers and the class is very easy. You also get to watch movies and tv shows for lab.
Generous, understanding, and knowledgeable. Great professor.

D'acci is really clear and laid back. She has an outline for every lecture so it's pretty easy to follow along. Go to lecture because that's pretty much where the questions on the exam come from. Go to section. Over all the class wasn't very difficult. Study for exams and write all the journals, but you don't need to kill yourself. I enjoyed it.

She is extremely clear, set out an outline of every lecture before class which makes studying a breeze, exams are multiple choice and easy as long as you pay attention and do the readings.  The class itself is interesting and entertaining, we watch movie and TV clips often.  She's very open to questions, genuinely cares about our understanding.
No Comments
Very good lectures, organized and clear. Uses lots of film clips to engage the students. However, exams are somewhat tricky: she picks details instead of concepts/main points.

Don't listen to other entries- you only will have problems with tests if you assume because the material is TV and movies, you don't have to study. Treat it like any other 3 credit class- and I guarntee you will find her style fun and laid back.

D'Acci is really laid back- she is fun and straightforward- but the exams really are confusing. She picks little details out of the material and eventhough she says she makes "straight forward questions" - they are quite tricky.

Usually wastes 20 minutes of lecture time going over nothing in particular.  The material covered seemed easy and dull, yet the exams were horribly confusing.  I had no clue what I was supposed to be learning. Her teaching style lacks focus.
